title: Natwest retrains staff to better help bereaved customers
text:
Natwest is retraining branch staff to help bereaved customers better

Natwest is retraining branch staff after grieving customers were told to notify the bank of a death online.

Money Mail told last week of recently widowed Philip Enticknap, who was wrongly advised he could not report the death of his wife, Val, at his local branch in Fleet, Hampshire.

NatWest apologised and confirmed the bank does not require customers to report deaths online.

But another reader contacted Money Mail to say they had been told the same thing in an Exeter branch.

NatWest has now pledged to include guidance on how to help bereaved customers in a weekly email sent to all 899 NatWest branches.

Staff will also be reminded to inform customers of the death notification service, which helps people inform multiple banks of a death using one form.
